topic.title: The Forum Rules
topic.body:
## The Forum Rules
*Version 0.1*
*Feb 01, 2019*

1. The Rules apply to the following **Services**:

  * [Talks: General](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1fznctFebYHnmjmFZCmAWPd7nnamAy3Tg)
  * [Talks: ZeroNet Support](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1fznc4VQbbrQAf4UzHrWS6W2mpGFqXSeD)
  * [Talks: ZeroNet Development](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1fznczNZUMEMvCiqSmCZGUiv5sVnRcsTD)
  * [Talks: Politics](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1fzncJdLpbsT5eeeYP14EKSaStHhtn5LY)
  * [Administration](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1fzncGxeyDpbCz1CkvBkooEDsXGFq1GfK)

2. The following is **strictly prohibited** on the **Services**:

   * automated posting, spam, lots of meaningless messages;
   * hate speech; discrimination of people on any ground, such as gender, orientation, race, origin, nationality and others;
   * adult content, pornography;
   * selling or buying drugs; discussions about ways to use drugs;
   * selling or buying explicitly illegal products or services such as weapons, contracts for assassination etc;
   * discussing ways and/or planning to commit explicitly illegal actions.

   The **Administration** unconditionally bans the accounts that violate this rule.

3. The following is **unwelcome** on the **Services**:

   * criticism aimed at a person, not at his/her opinions;
   * extensive use of the obscene language;
   * posting messages to inappropriate sections of the Forum.

   The **Administration** may delete posts of that kind. In case of multiple repetitive violations, the account may be banned.

4. Please choose the correct section of the Forum when posting:
  * [Administration](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1fzncGxeyDpbCz1CkvBkooEDsXGFq1GfK) is for administration issues of the Services.
  * [Talks: ZeroNet](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1fznc4VQbbrQAf4UzHrWS6W2mpGFqXSeD) is for topics related to ZeroNet.
  * [Talks: ZeroNet Development](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1fznczNZUMEMvCiqSmCZGUiv5sVnRcsTD) is for topics related to the development of the ZeroNet engine and zite engines.
  * [Talks: Politics](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1fzncJdLpbsT5eeeYP14EKSaStHhtn5LY) is for talks about politics.
  * [Talks: General](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1fznctFebYHnmjmFZCmAWPd7nnamAy3Tg) is for other kinds of talks.

5. Banned accounts can be restored at the discretion of the **Administration**, but not earlier than a month after the ban. The **Administration** is not responsible for any data loss on the banned account, that is occurred due to implementation details of the ban procedure.

* * *

*Please maintain the constructive and friendly atmosphere on the Forum!*

topic.title: Administrative positions
topic.body:
### Description of the administrative positions

* **Administrator**
  The owner of the primary private keys of the sites.
  Administrator has the full control over sites, including the ability to add, delete and modify any data.

* **Supermoderator**
  Supermoderator can modify `data/users/content.json`, which leads to the following privileges:
  * Ban and unban users.
  * Modify the size limit of user data.
  * Add new user ID providers.
  * Modify or delete any posts, comments etc.
  * Appoint moderators.

* **Moderator**
  Moderator can modify `data/users/*/content.json`, which leads to the following privileges:
  * Modify or delete any posts, comments etc.

1549432992_1GooUE19488nDwG3TdkM8seYAHct4.body:
> [quantumworld](#comment_1_1AdWXZdPUimpXoGNXUBde2CHR7gLf4onxE): I am a total Newbe on this size limit. What is it? And how would one change it if they were running there own zite.

The site owner sets a limit, how much data can be uploaded by a user.

See http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/data/users/content.json as an example.
Sections `permission_rules` and `permissions`. The former sets the defaults, and the latter tunes the values per user.
